/* Comments by other users */ Added my defence against these allegations
Restored revision 1024653273 by [[Special:Contributions/Cyberanthropologist|Cyberanthropologist]] ([[User talk:Cyberanthropologist|talk]]): Accidental revert on the talk page, hence reverted

The user @cyberanthropologist is making baseless claims against my account, consistent with wikipedia's policy of Bullying. Tag [[WP:BULLY]] He has also vandalised the wikipedia page by removing relevant academic sources cited in a chronological order. Restoring to last best version.

/* Historical Vellala personalities mentioned as Vaishyas */  fixed typos
Fixed the Headers and sub headers for Varna classification in chronological order
Arranged the Vaishya classification in chronological order.
Restored the removed sources explaining the Vellalar protest in detail, moved them to the Vaishya section. Entire article cannot be quotes.
Restored the Tolkappiyam header and relevant academic sources and citations which were removed.Do not vandalise the page. @cyberanthropologist
Reverted 35 edits by [[Special:Contributions/Cyberanthropologist|Cyberanthropologist]] ([[User talk:Cyberanthropologist|talk]]) to last revision by TheBrokenTusk
Added a history section and Anthropologist Irawati Karve's citation on the traditional Vellala origin of Chettis as a Dhana-Vaishya sub sect of Vaishyas, with url.
Fixed typo, added *where he* before "mentions" in the last line of 1st paragraph of early life section.

Added Vaishya and Vellala status of Nammazhwar as given by Dr.P.Jayaraman in  page 60 of his book "A Brief History of Vaishnava Saint Poets : The Alwars", published by Vani Prakashan, 2019. Added a citation and url for the same.
Fixed typo, Nammazhwar in the last line of the 1st paragraph of the early life section.
Added information about Nammazhwar's Vaishya status, classified among the four great Vaishya saints of Hindusim by the All India Vaishya Samaj in 1988, with citation and web url to book
Added a link for 1961 Indian Census division classification of Vellalas as Vaishyas, with links to Google books, PDF, and official Government census website.
Added Simon Casie Chitty's classification of Karkatha Vellalars as Bhu-Vaishya with citation
Corrected sfnp error: multiple targets (2×): CITEREFRajannan1992

Elaborated on the terms Bhupalar, gopalar, Dhanapalar & Bhu Vaishya, Dhana Vaishya, Go Vaishya with proper citations, references and links from Historian Usha R Vijalakshmi(2010), Busnagi Rajannan(1992), Simon Casie Chitty (2016), Anthropologist Irawati Karve (1981) and Indian Census Division (1961).
Added information about the Karmandala Satakam by Usha R. Vijailakshmi with citation and references.
Added a link for 1961 Indian Census division classification of Vellalas as Vaishyas, with links to Google books, PDF, and official Government census website.

@TheBrokenTusk Here look at page 607 and 633 of the Karnataka Census, it classifies the Gounder, Mudaliar and Pillai separately from the Vysya caste in tabular columns(I’ve provided the link in the talk page), also you can extrapolate the citations of another source about nammalavar being a Vaishya to the  1981 census. And make your own conclusion. Does the 81 census classify them as Vaishyas or not? NO.
